data.title: Stop Ctrl + C of complete line on empty cursor
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Use an empty cursor
2. Press ```Ctrl + C```

This ```Ctrl + C``` duplicates the entire line. Its more of a disadvantage rather than advantage. Suppose, I have an item on clipboard that I would like to paste and instead of ```Ctrl + V``` I mistakenly do ```Ctrl + C```. This results in losing the previous clipboard item that I needed.

So can you stop ```Ctrl + C`` of complete line on empty cursor

data.title: Conflict between theme colors and user preferences
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.4

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Set the `editor.lineHighlightBackground` and `editor.lineHighlightBorder` in a theme.
2. Set the `editor.renderLineHighlight`preference to `line`or `all` in user preferences.
3. The highlighted line is always shown as `all` because the `editor.lineHighlightBackground` setting has higher priority.

**Expected behavior:**

If the theme has colors set for the highlighted line for both background and border, it should only paint with the color selected in the user preferences.


Original report by @MariusVatasoiu on my theme: [vangware/dark-plus-material/issues/2](https://github.com/vangware/dark-plus-material/issues/2)

data.title: HTML Format: Unformatted attributes setting
data.body:
There's currently `html.format.unformatted` setting which allows to specify a list of **tags** that shouldn't be reformatted. It would be great to have also a list of **attributes** that shouldn't be reformatted by `html.format.wrapAttributes` setting.

Motivation behind this: For Angular apps development I'd personally like to put tag's **native attributes** on the same line as the **start tag** and put Angular's **directives** on following lines like this:
```html
<input type="number" class="form-control" id="percent" name="percent" placeholder="Percent"
       *ngIf="displayPercent"
       #percent="ngModel" 
       [(ngModel)]="item.percent"
       [readOnly]="readOnly"
       [min]="0"
       [max]="100">
```

I'm pretty sure this increases readability a lot.

I'm telling the motivation because maybe you would come up to a more convenient solution rather that just provide a setting for specifying a list of attributes to be ignored for such case. :)

data.title: Welcome Page should assist user configuring VS Code
data.body:
There should be interactive welcome page when user start the code first time. It should ask user some basic questions:

1. Which Language does he work with, with a multiple languages options.
2. Does he use code in multiple machines and want to sync them.

Upon his selections, Code should **suggest** the extensions like Python , Project Manager, My Code Settings Sync or other extensions inside the welcome page **along with the current featured extensions**

data.title: TS Server crashes once TS file is open
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.4 (16E195)

The project is private so I can't share the code or steps to reproduce it though I'm going to provide some logs, hopefully will be enough. If you need something else please ask.
The file that I open is about 1100 lines and it's a pure typescript file that is importing some of `lodash`, `d3` and `angular v4`.
As soon as I open this file TS Server crashes and nothing will work anymore! TS Server restarts but it gets stuck at binding forever, and the only way to get Code to work is to restart.
This issue started right after updating to 1.12

[Here is the TS Server log file](https://pastebin.com/7PSLXsGC)
[Here is the ChromeDevTools console](http://i65.tinypic.com/1z4ki20.png)

data.title: [theme] add text colors
data.body:
Text colors should be used for formatted text (e.g. preview, markdown, send a smile text) but also in views for richer labels.

- `description.foreground`: Foreground color for description text providing additional information, for example for a label.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/25852154/aa87e782-34c8-11e7-85e9-edc0d84b3ca6.png)

- `textPreformat.foreground`: Foreground color for preformatted text segments.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/25852179/ccd589a2-34c8-11e7-8731-287bfcb656ac.png)

- `textSeparator.foreground`: Color for text separators.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/25852171/bf1dac2c-34c8-11e7-9357-1a9f8d1e7132.png)

- `textBlockQuote.background`: Background color for block quotes in text.
- `textBlockQuote.border`: Border color for block quotes in text.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/25852195/d71b2ed0-34c8-11e7-8b81-7912f5776de3.png)

- `textCodeBlock.background`: Background color for code blocks in text.

- `textLink.foreground`: Foreground color for links in text.
- `textLink.activeForeground`: Foreground color for active links in text.

data.title: Add a setting to define how the initial first window should size
data.body: We have `window.newWindowDimensions` to control how windows open after one has already been opened. People confuse this with also having an impact on the initial first window. We should either align this setting or introduce another one for the first window.

data.title: Command palette: allow matching in any-word order
data.body:
Hello,

Currently when I pressing `Cmd + Shift + P` and trying to find something - it search strings in the order that I have typed. For example, I type "Project open" and expect that it will find "Open Project". But it can't find it.

It will be amazing if you will implement the same ideology of search as it is in the Sublime Text. They allow to search words in any order, and even search strings by first letters or part of the word.

Example of the **Command Palette** in the SublimeText:
![687474703a2f2f616e67756c61722d75692e6769746875622e696f2f416e67756c61724a532d7375626c696d652d7061636b6167652f696d616765732f73637265656e73686f742d717569636b5f70616e656c2d7365617263682e706e67](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/630224/25847091/edc40378-34b4-11e7-9261-d4c4df2c499b.png)

*Be the best!
-- Anton*

data.title: Alt+i keybinding
data.body:
It's impossible to create user shortcut <alt+i>. The editor either prints "" symbol instead of triggering shortcut OR triggers shortcut and prints "" symbol at the same time.

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VSCode editor.
2. Goto Code -> Preferences -> Keyboard Shortcuts.
3. Click on keybindings.json.
4. Try to add new shortcut - press "cmd+K cmd+K" and in the dialog press "alt+i" combination. The symbol "" is added to the shortcut in the input field.
5. Press ENTER.
6. New shortcut will be created with param "key": "alt+i enter" (extra "enter" key).
7. Remove "enter"  and save keybindings.json
8. Press <alt+i>.
9. "" symbol will appear in text editor.

data.title: Git diff editor not closing after commiting
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Version 1607

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open Source Control tab
2. Click on modified file to open diff tab
3. Write commit message and click commit

In the previous version the diff tab would close automatically. Now it stays open.

Is there a way to activate the old behavior again through the settings?

data.title: Terminal: adopt scrollbar colors
data.body: Looks like terminal.css defines its own colors for scrolling ([here](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/terminal/electron-browser/media/scrollbar.css#L6)). I suggest to pick up the [colors from our theming service](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/platform/theme/common/colorRegistry.ts#L181) for scrollbars. An example for how to produce CSS to replace the hardocded colors can be found for example in [feedback.ts](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/feedback/electron-browser/feedback.ts#L349)

data.title: Keyboard: Space -> close the intellisense suggestions panel or insert a space
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: macOs Sierra 10.12.4 (16E195)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Type something in the VSCode editor, hit the space button, when the intellisense suggestions panel show up.
2. The result is VSCode will close the intellisense suggestions panel without inserting a space, but I just need that space, or I have to hit the space button again.

ps: I don't have this problem with the VSCode that the version is lower than 1.12.x. BTW, it is better VSCode will do the both stuff after I hit the space button, I think.

Any suggestions will be appreciated.

data.title: Highlight modified tabs
data.body:
Hi,

I would like to include a setting for highlighting modified tabs. Just the circle is not enough clear (for me). In Sublime Text for example there is a setting:

`"highlight_modified_tabs": true`

Just adding a CSS like this:

```
.tab.dirty .label-name {
    color: #ffcc66;
}

```
When the setting is true.

Thanks a lot.

data.title: Debuging, error linking to file and row by lines number from output [DEBUG CONSOLE]

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I'm not happy with solutions to execute code, scripts, etc.

 

- [ ] I want sugest solution with linking to file and row lines number from output to place where is error for debuging this place (line). Something like hyberlink.

1. python
` File "e:\PYTHON\test.py", line 10, in TestFunction self.test= SuperTest(self)`
- **line 10** can be as hyperlink to row 10 in test.py file (e:\PYTHON\test.py or e:/PYTHON/test.py) 
 File "e:\PYTHON\test.py", [line 10](/PYTHON/test.py#10), in TestFunction self.test= SuperTest(self)

There is **vscode-code-runner** plugin, but it's far in pratice from the optimal solutions what exist on market and other editors. 
https://github.com/formulahendry/vscode-code-runner/issues/111

BTW all errors methods for output from debugers is little old and simple, eg. why the outputs lines are not numered as rows (1. error 2. bug 3. noFunction) which can be more usefull in social consulting, citating the row only as number of row/line and etc.
Eg. PyScripter for Python is old and not much changes and have nice solutions as upper, eg. can show current bug
https://sourceforge.net/projects/pyscripter/

Maybe in ServerSide coding is not special needed, but not sure.. I mind that output is serverd on the web browser front side.

- [ ] Let we imagine that in MVC exist some bugs.. I repair them in some files and want run again the main script.. must find this file and execute. In my good pratice is that ctr+E execute current file and ctr+shift+E execute the last file or file setted as main in all project. This can help fast reduce number of errors in output and stupid clicking process (expensive time and booring way).
- In VSC is ctr+shift+f5 but in debug mode. If I chaning file to repair and try run this.. again execute current file and must back to the main.py and find this.

data.title: Setting for controlling the auto-expand of suggest docs to side/below
data.body:
Hi Ramya,

I do not really want to see the second suggest box window when there is not a lot of docs. Here is a clear example where I feel like we are wasting a lot of space.
The suggest box simply feels too heavy in this case.

Also I would suggest you add a setting to never render the second box for people who do not care about docs (like me).

The big pain here is that the long suggest box even jumps to the second editor group on the right.
fyi @joaomoreno

data.title: Empty file isn't editable
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Visual Code Insiders v1.13.0
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.4
- Settings:
```
{
    "editor.rulers": [
        120
    ],
    "editor.fontLigatures": true,
    "files.trimTrailingWhitespace": true,
    "editor.renderLineHighlight": "gutter",
    "workbench.colorTheme": "Monokai",
    "workbench.statusBar.visible": true,
    "window.zoomLevel": -1,
    "window.reopenFolders": "all",
    "workbench.iconTheme": "vs-seti",
    "terminal.integrated.fontSize": 10,
    "editor.fontFamily": "Fira Code, Menlo, Monaco, 'Courier New', monospace",
    "editor.fontSize": 14.4,
    "workbench.activityBar.visible": true,
    "git.confirmSync": false,
    "files.insertFinalNewline": true,
    "files.associations": {
        "*.hamlc": "haml",
        "*.scss.erb": "scss"
    },
    "editor.matchBrackets": false,
    "editor.occurrencesHighlight": false,
    "editor.renderWhitespace": "none"
}
```

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new file (File > New File) OR open existing file and delete all content
2. try to type
3. typing doesn't work until min. 1 character or line break is pasted

    "window.newWindowDimensions": "inherit"
}```

Tested on a clean vscode right after installation

data.title: Add "don't show again" functionality to messages...
data.body:
... and start using it in the message which tells you your extension is overwritten, when debugging it. It really gets annyoing after a while.

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Write an extension for vscode
2. Publish that
3. Install it normally from the marketplace
4. Work further on your extension and start a debugging session
5. Everytime you start the debugging host it shows you a message telling you that your extension is being overwritten. After 100-200 times it begins to bore you, so I'd like to suppress it.

Steps to Reproduce:
